channel.title: Comments on: On Being A Consultant: Lessons Learned, Month One
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Kevin Boles
item.dc:creator: Kevin Boles
item.content:encoded:
I think you should consider yourself lucky that you were paid as a consultant to learn things you didn’t know already. It has been my experience that that doesn’t happen very often (at least for those of us not with the huge firms). If I were a company I would be leery paying a consultant to pick up a new skill that they implement for me, although a long-term consultant that had significant knowledge of my company’s data and processes would change that equation.

Best,

Kevin
I hope the change to consulting continues to be a good one for you over the long haul!

item.title: By: Hossam Alfraih (@SaudiGeekNET)
item.dc:creator: Hossam Alfraih (@SaudiGeekNET)
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jes!

Great step.

Looking for the “Month Two” lesson.

Wish you all the best.

~ Hossam
